result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Dominic Mathauer

records.addlTxt:
9:55 AM Defendant Christopher Dominic Mathauer in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Christopher Dominic Mathauer.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

12:01 PM Defendant Christopher Dominic Mathauer in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Christopher Dominic Mathauer.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Court reviews file. State makes argument. Atty Lawton makes argument. Court makes ruling. Court finds probable cause.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:43 AM Defendant Christopher Dominic Mathauer in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Christopher Dominic Mathauer.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. State calls Investigator Tia Hartl to the stand. Clerk swears in. State begins questioning. Court finds the witness has identified the defendant. Nothing further. Witness excused. Argument. Court would like parties to do some research on case. State makes argument. Case law due to the court by end of business Friday. Set for oral ruling. Bond to continue.
Oral ruling scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Oral ruling on August 15, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Christopher Dominic Mathauer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Christopher Dominic Mathauer.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Defendant makes statement. Off record for parties to speak. Back on record at 10:16 AM. Court recalls case. Parties have reviewed complaint. Waived reading. Defendant demanding speedy trial on both counts. Set for prelim. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:09 PM Defendant Christopher D. Mathauer appeared by video in custody. Assistant District Attorney Christian Ness appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. The Court questions Atty Ness. The Court questions the victim.  The Court questions Ms. Tammy Fee- victim witness coordinator re. safety plan/assessment.  The Court questions the victim. The Court questions the DE. Atty Ness opposes bond modification. The Court questions the victim. The Court questions the DE. The Court modifies the bond to allow telephone contact only. If the DE is able to post bond, the contact reverts back to no contact. No abusive contact. No intimidation of witness. No discussing the case. Clerk to do addendum. Adjourned.

1:07 PM Defendant Christopher Dominic Mathauer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared specially by video for Christopher Dominic Mathauer.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Court reviews the probable cause. Court finds probable cause.
Court questions the defendant. Address in CF files remain the same. Defendant does not have contacts with Washburn County. State makes bond argument-requesting $2500 cash w/ conditions. Argument from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Court sets bond.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
